intro: Xerochrysum halmaturorum, commonly known as the Halmaturine everlasting, is a flowering plant native to South Australia. It produces small, bright yellow to golden-orange flowers that are tightly packed in dense, spherical clusters. The plant is a member of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. It is drought-tolerant and thrives in well-drained soils, making it suitable for arid and semi-arid environments. The plant's name refers to its ability to retain its color and form even after drying, a trait that makes it popular in floral arrangements.
